Description: Book of the Dead of Tentawy; frame 1; black outline vignettes along top.
Production place: Original from: Thebes (historic - Upper Egypt) (Auction Catalogue)
Curator's comments: In two lots at Salt sale 1835, lots 955 (acquired by Payne) and 956 (Thorpe). Published: Mosher, The Papyrus of Hor, (2001), p.77 n.23. Mosher, Malcom Jr. 2016. The Book of the Dead, Saite through Ptolemaic periods : a study of traditions evident in versions of texts and vignettes (SPBD Studies), vol. I (BD Spells 1-15) and II (BD Spells 16, 18-30), Charleston.
Bibliographic references: Quirke 1993 / Owners of funerary papyri in the British Museum (261)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (57207) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/57207)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: distorted, loss Black ink Red ink Backed: brown paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: Filmoplast T Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A Curatorial condition comment: incomplete - glass cracked
